gurmukhi: jYsy kr ghq srp suq pyiK mwqw khY n pukwr Puslwie aur mMf hY
transliteration: Jaisay Kar Gahat Sarap Sout Paykhi Maataa , Kahai N Poukaar Dhousalaai Ur Mand Hai ?
translation: Just as seeing a snake in the hands of her son, the mother does not shout but very calmly endears him to herself.

gurmukhi: jYsy byd rogI pRiq khY n ibQwr biRQw sMjm kY AauKd Kvwie rog fMf hY
transliteration: Jaisay Bayd Rogee Prati Kahai N Bidaar Bridaa , Sanjam Kai Aoukhad Khavaai Rog Dand Hai ?
translation: Just as a physician does not disclose the details of ailment to the patient but serves him medicine within strict preventions and makes him well.

gurmukhi: jYsy BUil cUik ctIAw kI n bIcwrY pwDw kih kih sIiKAw mUrKq miq KMf hY
transliteration: Jaisay Bhooli Chooki Chateeaa Kee N Beechaarai Paadhaa , Kahi Kahi Seekhiaa Moorakhat Mati Khand Hai ?
translation: Just as the teacher does not take the mistake of his student to heart, and instead he removes his ignorance by imparting him with necessary lesson.

gurmukhi: qYsy pyiK Aaugun khY n siqgur kwhU pUrn ibbyk smJwvq pRcMf hY ]356]
transliteration: Taisay Paykhi Aougoun Kahai N Satigur Kaahoo , Pooran Bibayk Samajhaavat Prachand Hai ?356?
translation: Similarly, the True Guru says nothing to a vice-infested disciple. Instead, he is blessed with complete knowledge. He makes him understand and changes him into a sharp-minded wise person. (356)
